Specify closure rules

How do closures in Viuact work? This requires answering several
questions:

- how do they capture their environment (by copy? by reference?)
- how is the fact that a function is a closure detected
- are closures mutable or not
- what are the constraints under which closures work (e.g. the number of
  allocated registers may be limited)

...and probably more.

The first thing that may surprise a programmer is that closures capture
their environment by copy. This is much easier to implement while
ensuring correctness. We don't have time for a better implementation due
to a very tight time budget.
